intro: Sopubia gracilis, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is characterized by its thin, erect stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces milky sap, which is a common feature among the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in full sun and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Sopubia gracilis is relatively drought-tolerant and is used in some traditional medicinal practices.
